body:
Comment 10 by **lucio.dere**: 
I seem to be causing a plan 9 system hang quite frequently now, but I can't be sure
whether it's the Go application that's responsible or whether it just tickles a problem
in the kernel.

Right now, I have "ls /proc" hanging in a rio window.  Stats shows full "load"
utilisation and I'm fairly certain that the Go application has been crashed when I
deleted the rio window it was hanging in.

The natural response to such a hang has been to type "ps" in another window and I am
convinced that doing so either jams the machine (not tightly: I can open new windows and
mess with the rio menu; some things get very slow) or causes the hanging Go application
to finish.

I know my guesses are usually uninspired, but /proc seems very much involved in the
problem and load saturation seems also relevant.  It is however hard to debug because
one can't easily access the guilty process.  I'm hoping that someone else may recognise
the symptoms as familiar and recommend some unconventional debugging technique (I'm not
much good with the conventional ones, I tend to use printf() a lot).

Lucio.
